author: alexp7
title: DWill - Cardanos Digital Testament
description: Digital assets inheritance is growing pain and very difficult to manage.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, the proposal effectively addresses the challenge. I really appreciate the problem identified the proposer as the transfer of digital assets upon death or incapacitation will likely continue to grow and become a serious issue in the crypto space. If successful, such a platform (DID backed Wills and Testaments) would likely give massive benefit to the community, however what is less clear is how this project specifically would impact the broader community. Yes, information gathering and analysis is good, but I would have liked to see a better justification for doing this project in this manner. I am left wondering what other type of work is already ongoing in the community with respect to this exact issue, and how will the project accelerate the adoption of DIDs? As written, it appears the project would likely explore the option of DIDs in such a system but would not necessarily lead to their adoption, say if certain legal issues arise. To this end, is there a certain jurisdiction being examined first? How would the different legal regimes be accounted for? In order to get full marks for impact I would have liked to see a section  exploring/explaining these types of considerations .
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, given the experience and plan presented it is highly likely that this proposal would be implemented successfully. I appreciate that the proposer has shared a link to their credentials so that voters can look should they so choose. The proposer also has a good track record of success within the Cardano community which increases confidence that they have the ability to deliver the project. I am confused a bit however, why the proposer did not add in the credentials of the identified UX researcher since he is already on the team and will be responsible for half the work. What is also missing for me, however, is a clear timeline or roadmap for when this work will be completed. The deliverables are well laid out and the KPIs appear achievable but I am not sure over what timeline. If going off of the budget it appears that this only a 2 month project but for what is being suggested this is likely insufficient. To get full marks here, I would have liked to see this timeline and at what intervals the steps would be taken. The budget is quite reasonable and if successful could return dividends to the community for such a small amount, however for the reasons stated above more detail is needed for full marks.
f6_assessments.q2: It is unclear from the proposal how it would be audited appropriately. While I appreciate the experience of the proposer as provided in the proposal, it is unclear how the community would be able to track and engage with the proposers. By opening the surveys to "volunteers" the proposer could inherently be skewing the results due to the fact that those who volunteer are often the ones with the most to say, and may not accurately reflect the situation. What criteria would be used to select these people, how would they be vetted once identified, and what, if any, safeguards are in place to ensure accuracy and clarity for the project? While the KPIs and deliverables are clear, what is less obvious is how the proposer will present their findings back to the community or tap into the community knowledge to help improve it. I am giving this proposal a 3/5 (neither agree or disagree) because more details are needed for voters to feel confident this could be audited appropriately. If not successful in this fund, adding these components to the next submission would surely result in full marks.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the problem of finding real use cases for DIDs. They will ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by bringing more use cases to  DIDs, driving more transactions and users. The metrics of this proposal is on doing research and not necessarily aligned with the challenge, but the long term metrics of creating a digital testament/will that makes use of DIDs are aligned with the challenge. The end project will be able to scale as it is an existing model that is already used offchain.
f6_assessments.q1: Relevant skills for this proposal have been proved with LinkedIn page. The budget is reasonable and broken down into 2 items. UX and Lead researcher. They will complete their research in 2 months, which is very reasonable.  They explain in detail how they will do the research and break it down into different parts.  Also providing items that will be constructed with the research. They haven't considered any risks. Not being aware or prepared for risks, will slow you down.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a project progress indicators section that indicates a roadmap with milestones and KPIs all in one. They also provided a list of deliverables when the research is complete. This will make measuring the progress and performance of the project very easy. They identify the need for creating Digital wills and they intend to solve this by first doing research on the topic to discover the best way to approach building this product.

f6_assessments.q0: `the subject (inheritance of digital assets) is ne that affects every crypto owner. So potential impact is as great as can be imagined. And even if only for ADA holders, that's already massive.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is for research into a topic that is broad ranging. The background of the proposer, and his analysis of the domain suggests he can conduct the research .
f6_assessments.q2: the topic is huge, the domain of information is broad. The proposer has given tangible metrics by which to audit performance. Not too much to think about. And finally, the budget is quite reasonable.

f6_assessments.q0: Connecting smart contracts and wills to smart contracts is a great idea. If the proposal is implemented and developed to full potential, it will increase accelerate DID adoption and increase Cardano utility.
f6_assessments.q1: The team provided work history and experience with links to LinkedIn and the work previously done in the Cardano community. Considering the plan is not complicated to execute, I believe that the proposal will be implemented sucessfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is small, simple and self-explanatory. The team created milestones and created KPIs to measure performance over time. I believe the proposal will be easy to audit.

solution: SmartContracts in Cardano can provide the basis for secure automation of Testaments and Decentralized Identities can enable the use case
experience: ATALA Prism 1st Cohort Pioneer. 20+ years Building Digital Products and Tech Companies. Active Catalyst Member, CA, Funded proposer.
